editorialNotes.tagline: Learn to read with a friend

editorialNotes.short: Powerful astronomy toolkit to screen the night sky.

ios.subtitle: The fun way to solve equations

name: Funny Farm: toddler flashcards
artistName: DOG&FROG Educational preschool kids games for girls and boys, toddlers and babies

ios.subtitle: Be a vet and heal the animals

editorialNotes.tagline: Interact with the power of nature
editorialNotes.standard: Part digital toy and part planetary handbook, The Earth gives kids insight into the workings of our world in a way that’s delightfully intuitive and fun. From rockslides to earthquakes to erupting volcanoes, these artful interactive dioramas respond to tapping and swiping with results that are both whimsical and educational. An accompanying guide for parents and teachers delves into the technical science behind all these phenomena, but kids can explore, experiment, and absorb earthly knowledge at their own pace.
editorialNotes.short: Play with interactive models to understand our planet.

editorialNotes.tagline: Play with sun, wind, and air
editorialNotes.standard: Once again, the creators of The Human Body and Simple Machines have turned playtime into a rich learning experience. Tinybop’s sandbox-style app lets kids experiment to their hearts’ content—seeing what happens when they move the sun, whip up winds, and cause rainstorms. A zoomed-out view illustrates the broader water cycle at work, while fascinating closeups show things like the effects of changing temperatures and strengthening tornadoes on everyday life. We also dig the detailed study guide offering extra info and discussion ideas.

ios.subtitle: Audio to help relax and sleep
Make a routine & put on a show

editorialNotes.standard: Bursting with beats and energy, Toca Dance will make the whole family want to get up and groove. This incredibly cute game puts kids in charge of their own musical production—choosing dancers, costumes and techno tracks, and choreographing moves using simple swipes and taps. Once the performance starts, the real fun begins: you can fling items at the stage, set off pyrotechnics and other cool effects and even cheer (or boo) your squad. Seeing the payoff—an awesome video you can share—will encourage players to jump right back in and start working on their next great show.

editorialNotes.short: See internal organs in action: lungs breathe, muscles bend and nerves respond to a pinprick.

ios.subtitle: Create to show what you know!

editorialNotes.standard: Ever pondered the atomic weight of Bismuth? Do you debate the density of Niobium over dinner? If so, this app is for you. Chemistry truly comes to life with this fully interactive version of the periodic table. Engage with the elements like never before and witness the wonders of science in beautiful detail.
editorialNotes.short: Chemistry comes to life with this interactive version of the periodic table.

name: Kids Learning to Read - Little Reader CVC Words

editorialNotes.standard: Kids (and kids at heart) can unleash their inner scientists with this captivatingly clever robot-creation kit, which features millions of different combinations for mechanical inventions. Whether you’re assembling a wheeled bot with laser guns for arms or a jolly jumping automaton with pogo-stick legs, taking your new bot on a walk through the woods will highlight the success—or the rough edges—of your design. While The Robot Factory teaches some nifty physics basics, we like to play around just for the pure fun of it.
editorialNotes.short: Design and experiment with all types of robots.
